\subsection*{Main program}

\begin{verbatim}
wd=4;
% t=0:2*pi/wd:2*pi+2*pi/wd;
t=0:2*pi/wd:2*pi;
x=cos(t);
y=sin(t);

figure(3); clf;
plot(x,y,'.-','MarkerSize',24);
grid on;
set(gca,'xlim',[-1.1 1.1],'ylim',[-1.1 1.1]);


syms A [2 2]
syms b [2 1]

A*b

Rt=@(th) [cos(th) -sin(th); sin(th) cos(th)];

xyD=[1;1];

xyD2=Rt(pi/2)*xyD;

figure(4); clf;
plot(xyD(1),xyD(2),'b.','MarkerSize',24),hold on;
plot(xyD2(1),xyD2(2),'r.','MarkerSize',24),hold on;
plot([-2 2],[0 0],'k-');
plot([0 0],[-2 2],'k-');

grid on;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim} 
ans =
 
A1_1*b1 + A1_2*b2
A2_1*b1 + A2_2*b2
 
\end{verbatim} \color{black}

\subsection*{Supplementary information to publish}

\begin{par}
If you want to make a pdf or html file on the code, you can use the code "x\_publish\_each\_codes.m" in the same folder. Please change the file name as " this\_file\_tag='lec*\_step*' " (* will be replaced to the number of the target file).
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{par}
The code "x\_publish\_all\_codes.m" works for such a publication applying to all codes in the same folder (Note: "x\_publish\_all\_codes\_sub.m" should be located in the same folder).
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
